David Saff wrote:
> Elliotte,
> 
> What would you expect the test runner to do if it caught one of these 
> exceptions?  In general, I would expect that listeners should not 
> interrupt the test execution: if they find themselves unable to do what 
> they want, they should quietly deal with it on their own.
>

Somebody has to listen or there's not much point to running the tests. 
If the sole listener has an encountered an unrecoverable error, there's 
not much point to continuing. Possibly that's not the case if there are 
multiple listeners, but I think a single listener is the vast majority 
of use cases.
